Pre-Game Insights: The Cincinnati Reds' Rhett Lowder is on a nice run lately, giving up only one earned run across 15.1 innings of work in his last three starts.
The Reds' pitching was great on Saturday, only using one bullpen arm (Brent Suter).
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Reds had one big inning with a whopping nine runs in the fourth on Saturday.
The 'Inning 1 UNDER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the Reds' last four day games.
Seven of the Reds' last eight day games after playing the previous day have gone UNDER the total runs line.
Each of the Twins' last four games have gone OVER the total runs line.
Others: Byron Buxton has recorded two or more total bases in each of his last six appearances in day games.
Byron Buxton has recorded at least one RBI in each of his last five appearances at Target Field against NL opponents that held a losing record.
Carlos Santana has recorded a Single in each of his last five appearances against opponents that held a losing record.
Kyle Farmer has recorded at least one hit in each of his last eight appearances.
TJ Friedl has hit a home run in four of the Reds' last five games as road underdogs against AL Central opponents.
Spencer Steer has recorded a Double in four of the Reds' last five road games against AL Central opponents.
